item.title: How to read the cover image from an EPUB file in Python
item.description: A code example in Python of how to read the cover image from an EPUB file, the most widely supported vendor-independent (as opposed to PDF) XML-based e-book format.

item.title: How to determine the character encoding of a text file
item.description: If you have ever encountered a text file with gibberish characters, then you know that -many times- it is quite difficult to determine its correct character encoding.

item.title: Git & Mercurial: How to commit-push fast and easily
item.description: Git and Mercurial are cross-platform, distributed revision-control tools for software development and other version control tasks. We present two bash scripts, one for each tool, to help us commit and push our changes fast and easily.

item.title: How to get info for the wireless interface using nl80211 in C
item.description: The nl80211 is the 802.11 netlink-based userspace interface for the new cfg80211 configuration system for wireless hardware. We show how we can request and receive name, signal and txrate of a wireless interface.

item.title: Creation of a transparent shutdown GUI using Gtk and Cairo in Python
item.description: Many window managers in Linux are lacking a graphical shutdown interface. In a previous article, we showed how we can implement one, quite easily, using gtk and python. Now, we will show how to make it transparent using Cairo.

item.title: Creation of a shutdown GUI using Gtk in Python
item.description: Many window managers in linux are lacking a graphical shutdown interface. Here, we show how we can implement one, quite easily, using gtk and python.

item.title: 3D visualization of Sutherland-Hodgman algorithm (polygon clipping)
item.description: In this article, we implement in C++ a visualization of the Sutherland–Hodgman algorithm (polygon clipping) in the 3D space.

item.title: Retriever of Lost Dreams
item.description: Your name is Rold. You live in a very special place in the Universe. This place is called Dreamland. Your job is to foster and guard the Dream Stars. For, from their stardust, the people’s dreams are born.

item.title: Quotests
item.description: This application consists of multiple choice quizzes to test your English language skills. But there is a twist. Instead of using common boring phrases, it features text from great quotes by famous people!

item.title: Russian songs with greek translation
item.description: Chastúshka (russian: часту́шка, pl. часту́шки) is a traditional type of humorous folk song with high beat frequency.

item.title: The declension of russian nouns (available in greek only)
item.description: Declension table of russian nouns and some important exceptions.

item.title: Alamot's matchstick puzzles
item.description: 100 awesome matchstick puzzles! Can you solve them all? Great variety of categories.

item.title: How to build a responsive popup window with scrolling capability in Kivy
item.description: Kivy is an open source Python library for rapid development of applications. In this article, we show how to build a responsive popup window with scrolling capability.

item.title: The Neo-Babylonian Empire
item.description: The Neo-Babylonian Empire (аlso known as the Chaldean Empire) was a short-lived empire (626-539 BCE) in the «Fertile Crescent» of the Middle East.

item.title: Mind control parasites. How do they do it?
item.description: Did you know that there are parasites that can manipulate the behavior of their host organism? The hairworms is such an example. Hairworms are long thin wormlike parasites. Their scientific name is Nematomorpha.

item.title: A consensus method for the prediction of aggregation-prone peptides in globular proteins
item.description: A consensus algorithm for the prediction of amyloidogenic determinants from sequence alone.
